result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David A. Marin

records.addlTxt:
9:54 AM Cases called: 22TR2168, 22CF457, 22CF716 & 22CM318 Defendant David A. Marin in court.  Attorney Erika Amundson in court for David A. Marin.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. There is an agreement. Victim/Witness statute complied with. 

Defendant enters a no contest plea to an amended Count 1 in 22CF457: Operate a Motor Vehicle without Owner's consent without the repeater. 
Defendant enters a no contest plea to an amended Count 1 in 22CF716: Threat to a Law Enforcement Officer without the repeater.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders:
2 years Probation sentence withheld with conditions on each count concurrent.

Conditions of Probation:
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
90 days jail with Huber on Count 1 in 22CF716 only; all stayed pending further order of the court. 
court costs and surcharges.

Anything else, including all of 22CM318 and 22TR2168, is ordered dismissed and read in. 

Jail credit if revoked from Probation
22CF457 - 2 days
22CF716 - 2 days

9:45 AM cases 22CF457 and 22CM318 called. Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David A. Marin in court, in custody.  Attorney Erika Amundson in court for David A. Marin. 
In 22CF457: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- Received by the Court. 
Defense was recently appointed and asks for a status conference. A status conference is scheduled for July 8th at 10:15 AM (in person).

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Cases called at 2:06 PM: 22CF457, 22CM318.
Defendant David A. Marin in court, in custody without counsel.
Attorney Tiffany Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State calls Officer Madali Harer of the ECPD.  She is sworn and testifies. Cross examination by Defense.
Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over. Branch 5 to schedule further proceedings.

Conditions:
No contact with Enterprise Rent A Car, Wisco's
Covers 22CM318, 22CF457

Cases called at 11:13 AM: 22CM318, 22CF457.
Defendant David A. Marin in custody via video conference from the jail with Attorney Katherine Cook. Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant requests Preliminary Hearing in 22CF457 and indicates he will represent himself.
Preliminary Hearing: 5/3/22 at 2:00 PM with 22CM318 to ride along.
